alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Haleakala Summit; Kahoolawe; Kipahulu; Lanai Leeward; Lanai Mauka; Lanai South; Lanai Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Central Valley South; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West; Molokai Leeward South; Molokai North; Molokai Southeast; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; South Haleakala; South Maui, Upcountry; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 19 at 4:31AM HST until July 19 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Maui, Molokai, Lanai, Kahoolawe, and the Big Island. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical Storm Calvin will produce periods of heavy rainfall over Maui and Hawaii Counties starting through this afternoon. Excessive rainfall may lead to flooding conditions and landslides over steep terrain, especially along east and southeast facing slopes.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
